entry.title: Event Delegation in JavaScript –Explained with an Example
entry.summary: Event Delegation is a pattern based upon the concept of Event Bubbling [/news/event-bubbling-in-javascript/]. It is an event-handling pattern that allows you to handle events at a higher level in the DOM tree other than the level where the event was first received. There's a video version of this topic [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aZ3JWv0ofuA]

entry.title: Event Bubbling in JavaScript – How Event Propagation Works with Examples
entry.summary: HTML elements receive different types of events, from click, to blur, to scroll, and so on. One behavior these events have in common is Event Bubbling. I'll explain what this behavior means in this article. I also made a video version of this article which you can watch here [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KaHZdW02Tg0].

entry.title: TypeError: 'int' object is not subscriptable [Solved Python Error]
entry.summary: The Python error "TypeError: 'int' object is not subscriptable" occurs when you try to treat an integer like a subscriptable object.
